content: pumpkin earrings by susan rainey lv2knit on ravelry lv2knitmn on instagram the rainey sisters blog https //theraineysisters com a friend bought a pair of pumpkin earrings at a craft show and asked if i could replicate them here is the result finished size about 1 in diameter x 5/8 inch high the right picture above shows earring on a quarter materials small amounts of fingering weight yarn in orange and brown or green i used dream in color jilly anticipation you will also need earring findings leverback hooks are shown needles us 0 2 0 mm dpns gauge 40 sts and 48 row per 4 inches gauge isn t essential knit tight provisionally cast on 30 sts leaving a long tail join in the round knit 12 more rounds k2tog across final round break yarn leaving a long tail and thread through sts w/o tightening activate prov sts k2tog across round run yarn through sts and tighten stuff pumpkin from other end thread tail onto needle and pass through to the other end and fasten_off tighten live sts thread yarn onto needle and wrap pumpkin tightly 7 times to create pumpkin shape fasten_off with green or brown fingering weight yarn cast on 3 sts and work 4 row i-cord break yarn and thread onto needle pass through i-cord to other end and attach to best looking end of pumpkin secure well attach earring to stem i sewed mine on but other ways would work
